name: Hotel Melia Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little concerned when we made our way from the metro station toward the hotel, there seemed to be a lot of building work going on in the area. As it happens, there is a lot of building work going on all over the city so it wasn't so unusual!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

likes.liked: — The large clean room and bathroowm
likes.disliked: — The views of the building sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On check in the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We were on the 15th floor and the views from the glass lift that takes you up are breathtaking.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large in comparison to most I have stayed in. The bathoom was gorgeous and very clean. Also the TV had a speaker in the bathroom which was cool.
reviews.title: Greatb stay at the Hilton, Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the Bice restaurant a couple of nights and although this didn't suit my taste (I prefer more vegetables) the service was very good.
reviews.title: The best holiday ever

likes.disliked: — Pointless and expensive minibar. An empty, colder fridge would be better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as the location, it doesn't actually take that long to walk to the old city.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In!

likes.disliked: — The location in relation to the rest of the city

reviews.text: Overall a great experience, one of the best I have had in a hotel and I travel quite a bit, when we checked in, automatically upgraded to the Hilton Executive Floors due to my Hilton Honors status. This then came with Free Cocktails, full breakfast and Snacks on their 26th floor balcony (tallest building in Valencia) and great views. It does note that the Metro is close, the nearest line downtown is a 5 minute walk to Yellow 1 Benniferi, it also has Blue 4 Palau de Congressos & Florista 3 minutes behind the hotel and this takes you to the Ocean. We even had an issue where my travel mate forgot his passport in the safe, and they were fantastic about helping him. Booked during the Fallas festival for $85/night on Hilton.com. Great Hotel
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed her during Las Fallas and at around £50 a night it was great. We only got this deal as we booked and paid in advance and it didn't include breakfast.
reviews.title: Perfect for Las Fallas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During Las Fallas to say staying in the city centre is noisy is an understatement. The Hilton is only 3 stops on the Metro from the centre of Valencia and during Las Fallas the trains run til around 5am so no problem getting back late and even that far out the fireworks still work us up at 8am!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not as good as some 4* hotels we have stayed in.

reviews.text: Our room was really big and spacious and having the pool etc was a great bonus. The pool area doesn't cater for children though and the only complaint was that the "hot tub" was pretty cold but that was nice after the sauna.
reviews.title: High on the Hilton

reviews.text: We would definitely use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Definitely NOT a 5 star

reviews.text: This Hilton is the way a Hilton should be with great service and knowledgeable and helpful staff. The hotel is extremely close to the conference venue but about 10 min cab ride from the historical center. That is why I gave four points and not five. The rooms are clean as they should be with everything being gorgeous. Every room has both bath and shower, and the breakfast is very good. Internet price was 10 Euro per hour and 17 per day, so no free internet.
reviews.title: Good location for conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Valancia Hilton for four nights. Rooms are spacious with comfortable beds. The bathroom has walk in shower and seperate bath. Breakfast was very good in buffetstyle, but you also can order waffles, pancakes, omelets etc. by the staff and it will be prepared for you. The items you can order are written on the small orange paper on your table and is included. Staff was extremely friendly and helpfull. The location off the hotel is far from centre, but a 10 minute walk to metrostation and 10 minute metroride and you are in the middle of the city. You also can take the tram which is on the other side of the hotel, the area looks in daylight friendly, but at night we had mixed feelings about this neighbourhood. So better take the metro. The only strange about the metro is that in despite of that the Spanish are nightpeople (To go out for diner with kids at 22.00 is normal) The metro service stops about 23.30.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for four nights at the end of May 2009. A new hotel in a new neighborhood, which is under intensive development. The hotel is very nice. We took a regular room which was vast enough for both of us. The room included king size bed, desk, armchair + footstool, HD TV screen (HD shows in Spanish only), in room safe (large enough to put a laptop) and a nice bathroom (shower separated from the bath tab).
reviews.title: Good Value For Our Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was warm and friendly. The concierge was very helpful and friendly (I saw him while he ordered patiently places in a restaurant for a nagger client), as the stuff at the front desk.
reviews.title: This really is a very good hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was varied and tasty (very expensive though – 19.50 Euro per person for walk in, 15 Euro for an advance order).
reviews.title: Oasis from Fallas madness

aka: Melia Valencia Palacio De Congresos Hotel Valencia
